official_title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that any health insurance reform bill that is enacted should require that family and temporary medical leave be incorporated as a basic or elective option for plan participants under certain circumstances.

summary.text: Declares that it is the sense of the Congress that any Act to address the health insurance needs of the U.S. people should require that paid or unpaid leave, as detailed in the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1992, be incorporated as a basic or elective option for specified events.

titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that any health insurance reform bill that is enacted should require that family and temporary medical leave be incorporated as a basic or elective option for plan participants under certain circumstances.
